page.title: 19STUDLAND NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: The land in and around Studland was bequeathed to the National Trust by the Bankes family in 1982,one of the largest gifts the charity has ever received.The Trust now has control over rents of local farms and is now running the new information centre, car parks, toilets and cafes along the beach.Four people are employed full -time and 10-12 part-time.Car-parks are to remain the present size in order to limit the number of visitors. The Trust is conscious of the need to preserve the environment from the ravages of the visitors.Paths,dunes and trackways are being erroded, and litter is a constant problem.The Trust aims to balance the desire of the public to visit the beach against the needs of the nearby Nature Reserve for tranquility.
